body.p: To his excellency the Governor of the Comwth of Ky

The undersigned your petitioners citizens of Carroll County would respectfully state that at the Spring term 1861 of the Carroll Circuit Court William Gardner was fined $50 for selling Liquor to a minor.
Gardner states that at the time the offense was committed he was ignorant of the existence of a law prohibiting such sales.

Your petitioners further state that Gardner is a man of limited means. That he has a family wholly dependent upon him for support. We state that since the fine was assesed Gardner has conducted himself as a law abiding citizen and we have reason to believe he will so conduct himself in the future.
We therefore request your excellency to remit said fine

William Gardner.
A R Gaunt C C C C
R. W. Masterson
H S Cox
